author: Collette Devlin
title: An apple tree in every garden: New ideas to help Wellingtonians survive the big one
text:
"This idea is more about people getting to know their neighbour, perhaps bringing them together at a community garden." KEVIN STENT/FAIRFAX NZ 
Wellington Mayor Justin Lester said the strategy laid out a coherent blueprint for dealing with future shocks and stresses. 
After Wellington was hit badly by the magnitude 7.8 Kaikoura earthquake on November 14, the council's disaster planners fast-tracked some of the initiatives. 
The council is already looking at getting homeowners to remove chimneys, reinforcing piles, and installing emergency water tanks. 
Discussions have started on how to protect key heritage areas such as Cuba St and Newtown, and bringing forward and upgrading water resilience (such as the Prince of Wales Park reservoir and emergency supply for the hospital in Newtown). 
The council is also working closely with central government on a broader resilience agenda for the region on areas such as electricity, port facilities and the transport network. Ad Feedback 
The resilience strategy sets out three goals: to ensure people are connected, empowered and feel part of a community; that decision-making at all levels is integrated and informed by knowledge about Wellington's shocks and stresses; and that homes, natural and built environment are healthy and robust. 
Mendonca presented the draft strategy to the council's city strategy committee on Tuesday, and councillors will be asked to approve the plan on Thursday. 
He believes the 30 focus areas are achievable, and Wellington is ready to move forward with it. 
Some of the proposals were a bit aspirational, but they were practical and achievable, he said. 
"We were careful to ensure this was the case. Now it's just a question of timing around implementation and funding." 
He was confident they would be funded because there was "a good appetite" for projects of that nature. 
Projects and initiatives requiring council funding that are not already provided for in the Long-Term Plan will be presented as part of Annual Plan or Long-Term Plan processes. 
In the foreword of the draft, Wellington Mayor Justin Lester said the strategy laid out a coherent blueprint for dealing with future shocks and stresses. Some of the plans are short-term and tactical, others are long-term and strategic, but they all had people at the centre, he said. - Stuff
